meanings.definition: Inferior in size, strength, or importance.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was punier than the adult dog.
meanings.sent2: The tiny plant was punier than the tall tree.
meanings.sent3: The punier pencil tried to challenge the larger marker.
meanings.sent4: Her punier voice was drowned out by the loud music.
meanings.sent5: The punier snowflake melted instantly in the warm sun.

meanings.definition: Small or weak in comparison to others.
meanings.sent1: The punier kitten struggled to keep up with its siblings.
meanings.sent2: The old bicycle was punier than the new one.
meanings.sent3: The punier cookie crumbled before it reached the plate.
meanings.sent4: His punier arguments were easily refuted by the opponent.
meanings.sent5: The punier flame flickered out in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: Less impressive or effective than something else.
meanings.sent1: The punier fireworks display disappointed the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The makeshift shelter was punier than the sturdy cabin.
meanings.sent3: His punier attempt at a joke fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The punier flashlight barely illuminated the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The punier boat struggled against the strong current.
